ip.name: ip
ip.description: IP of the node or delegate

httpPort.name: httpPort
httpPort.description: Http port of the node or delegate

wsPort.name: wsPort
wsPort.description: Web socket port for the node or delegate

accountAddressPublicKeyUsernameQuery.name: address
accountAddressPublicKeyUsernameQuery.description: Lisk address, public key or account name

accountAddressPublicKeyUsernamePath.name: account_id
accountAddressPublicKeyUsernamePath.description: Lisk address, public key or account name

recipient.name: recipient
recipient.description: Lisk address, public key or account name (recipientId)

sender.name: sender
sender.description: Lisk address, public key or account name (senderId)

transactionData.name: data
transactionData.description: Search in transaction data field. Exact match, but can use % as wildcard e.g. data=test%

storeId.name: storeId
storeId.description: Id of the object in the container

marketDataProvider.name: provider
marketDataProvider.description: Source of the news among different data providers (Poloniex, Bittrex, etc.)

address.description:
The Lisk Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It consists of multiple numbers followed by a big 'L' at the end.

publicKey.description:
The public key is derived from the private key of the owner of the account.
It can be used to validate that the private key belongs to the owner, but not provide access to the owners private key.

secondPublicKey.description: The second public key is derived from the second private key of an account, if the owner activated a second passphrase for her/his account.

address.description:
The Lisk Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It consists of multiple numbers followed by a big 'L' at the end.

publicKey.description:
The public key is derived from the private key of the owner of the account.
It can be used to validate that the private key belongs to the owner, but not provide access to the owners private key.

secondPublicKey.description: The second public key is derived from the second private key of an account, if the owner activated a second passphrase for her/his account.

address.description:
The Lisk Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It consists of multiple numbers followed by a big 'L' at the end.

publicKey.description:
The public key is derived from the private key of the owner of the account.
It can be used to validate that the private key belongs to the owner, but not provide access to the owners private key.

secondPublicKey.description: The second public key is derived from the second private key of an account, if the owner activated a second passphrase for her/his account.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the block.
Derived from the block signature.

height.description:
Height of the network, when the block got forged.
The height of the networks represents the number of blocks,
that have been forged on the network since Genesis Block.

version.description: Versioning for future upgrades of the lisk protocol.

payloadHash.description:
Hash of the payload of the block.
The payload of a block is comprised of the transactions the block contains.
For each type of transaction exists a different maximum size for the payload.

blockSignature.description:
Derived from a SHA-256 hash of the block header,
that is signed by the private key of the delegate who forged the block.

confirmations.description:
Number of times that this Block has been confirmed by the network.
By forging a new block on a chain, all former blocks in the chain get confirmed by the forging delegate.

previousBlockId.description: The id of the previous block of the chain.

numberOfTransactions.description: The number of transactions processed in the block.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of Lisk transferred.

totalFee.description: The total amount of fees associated with the block.

reward.description: The Lisk reward for the delegate.

totalForged.description:
Total amount of LSK that have been forged in this Block.
Consists of fees and the reward.

address.description: Lisk Address of the delegate who forged the block.

publicKey.description: Public key of th edelagte who forged the block.

secondPublicKey.description: Second public key of th edelagte who forged the block.

rewards.description: Amount of rewards in LSK collected during forging
Amount of rewards in LSK collected during forging

id.description:
Unique identifier of the transaction.
Derived from the transaction signature.

amount.description: Amount of Lisk to be transferred in this transaction.

fee.description: Transaction fee associated with this transaction.

height.description: The height of the network, at the moment where this transaction was included in the blockchain.

blockId.description: The Id of the block, this transaction is included in.

timestamp.description:
Time when the transaction was created.
UNIX Timestamp.

senderId.description: Lisk Address of the Senders' account.

senderPublicKey.description: The public key of the Senders' account.

senderSecondPublicKey.description: The second public key of the Senders' account, if it exists.

recipientId.description: Lisk Address of the Recipients' account.

recipientPublicKey.description: The public key of the Recipients' account.

signature.description:
Derived from a SHA-256 hash of the transaction object,
that is signed by the private key of the account who created the transaction.

signSignature.description: Contains the second signature, if the transaction is sent from an account with second passphrase activated.

items.description: If the transaction is a multisignature transaction, all signatures of the members of the corresponding multisignature group will be listed here.

confirmations.description:
Number of times that this transaction has been confirmed by the network.
By forging a new block on a chain, all former blocks and their contained transactions in the chain get confirmed by the forging delegate.

receivedAt.description: The timestamp of the moment, where a node discovered a transaction for the first time.

relays.description: Number of times, a single transaction object has been broadcasted to another peer.

ready.description:
Only present in transactions sent from a multisignature account, or transactions type 4 (multisignature registration).
False, if the minimum amount of signatures to sign this transaction has not been reached yet.
True, if the minimum amount of signatures has been reached.

amount.description: Amount of Lisk to be transferred in this transaction.

blockId.description: The Id of the block, this transaction is included in.

date.description: Time when the transaction was created in ISO format.

fee.description: Transaction fee associated with this transaction in LSK.

recipientId.description: Lisk Address of the Recipients' account.

senderId.description: Lisk Address of the Senders' account.

senderPublicKey.description: The public key of the Senders' account.

transactionId.description:
Unique identifier of the transaction.
Derived from the transaction signature.

ip.description: IPv4 address of the peer node.

httpPort.description: The port the peer node uses for HTTP requests, e.g. API calls.

wsPort.description: The port the peer node uses for Websocket Connections, e.g. P2P broadcasts.

os.description: The Operating System, that the peer node runs on.

version.description: The version of Lisk Core that the peer node runs on.

state.description:
The state of the Peer.
Available values: Connected, Disconnected, Banned

height.description:
Network height on the peer node.
Represents the current number of blocks in the chain on the peer node.

broadhash.description:
Broadhash on the peer node.
Broadhash is established as an aggregated rolling hash of the past five blocks present in the database.

nonce.description:
Unique Identifier for the peer.
Random string.

hostname.description: Hostname associated with the node's IP.

broadhash.description:
Broadhash is established as an aggregated rolling hash of the past five blocks present in the database.
Broadhash consensus serves a vital function for the Lisk network in order to prevent forks.
It ensures that a majority of available peers agree that it is acceptable to forge.

height.description:
Current block height of the node.
Represents the current number of blocks in the chain on the node.

networkHeight.description:
Current block height of the network.
Represents the current number of blocks in the chain on the network.

epoch.description: Timestamp of first block on the network.

milestone.description:
The Reward, each forger will get for forging a block at the current slot.
After a certain amount of slots, the reward will be reduced.

nethash.description:
Describes the network.
The nethash describes e.g. the Mainnet or the Testnet, that the node is connecting to.

supply.description: Total supply of LSK in the network.

reward.description:
The reward a delegate will get for forging a block.
Depends on the slot height.

timestamp.description: UNIX timestamp representing beginning of the aggregation interval

date.description: Date representing beginning of the aggregation interval

transactionCount.description: Count of all transactions in the given time span

volume.description: Sum of all transaction amounts and fees sent in the given time span (in Beddows unit)

distributionByType.description: Count of transactions by transaction type in the whole time interval

distributionByAmount.description: Count of transactions by amount range in the whole time interval

address.description: Lisk Address of the delegate the queried account voted for.

publicKey.description: Public key of the delegate the queried account voted for.

balance.description: Balance of the delegate the queried account voted for.

username.description: Username of the delegate the queried account voted for.

count.description: Number of items returned in the request.

offset.description: Defines how many items are skipped.

total.description: Total number of items in the database.

data.description: Number of items returned in the request.

basic.description: Total number of items in the database.

height.description: Number of nodes on the given height.

coreVer.description: Number of nodes on the given Lisk Core versions.

os.description: Number of nodes using a given operating system.

meta.description: Defines how many items are skipped.

links.description: Total number of items in the database.

data.description: List of news from the NewsFeed

count.description: Number of items returned in the request.

content.example: We are switching to a monthly #LiskDevUpdate format. We do so to continue providing detailed insight into our #devâ€¦ https://t.co/aq0Lo4PFxN
content.description: Post content provided by the chosen blog.

sourceId.description: Internal ID coming from the blog platform. For a Tweet it will be a TweetID generated by Twitter backend.

data.description: List of news from the NewsFeed
List of news from the NewsFeed

count.description: Number of items returned in the request.

total.description: Total number of items in the database.

source.description: Exchange as a source of the data

data.description: List of news from the NewsFeed

count.description: Number of items returned in the request.

total.description: Total number of items in the database.

source.description: Exchange as a source of the data

timeframe.description: Beginning of the timespan of provided data

fromTimestamp.description: Beginning of the timespan of provided data

toTimestamp.description: End of the timespan of provided data

data.description: List of values from a given excahnge

count.description: Number of items returned in the request.

total.description: Total number of items in the database.

source.description: Exchange as a source of the data

fromTimestamp.description: Beginning of the timespan of provided data

toTimestamp.description: End of the timespan of provided data

score.description: Search result score on the scale 0.0 - the worst, 1.0 - best

key.description: ID of received item - same as storeId
